ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped green chile (canned or fresh)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly spray a baking dish with vegetable oil cooking spray.
Melt coconut oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper (not included in allergy list).
Sear chicken breasts in the skillet for 2-3 minutes per side, until lightly browned.  Do not cook through.
Transfer chicken breasts to the prepared baking dish.
In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, green chile, cilantro leaves, and monterey jack cheese.
Spread the cheese mixture evenly over the seared chicken breasts.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through (internal temperature of 165°F/74°C) and cheese is melted and bubbly.
While chicken is baking, prepare the slaw: In a separate bowl, whisk together red wine vinegar and sesame oil. Add chopped green bell pepper and toss to coat.

Once the chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before serving. Serve chicken with the cilantro-lime slaw. (Alternatively, the slaw ingredients can be served on the side to allow the consumer to control how much they want)
Garnish with extra cilantro leaves, if desired.
response.name: Spicy Green Chile Chicken with Cilantro-Lime Slaw
